00023 #include "MinionThreeInputReader.hpp"

00027 #include <fstream>
00028 #include <iostream>
00029 #include <boost/iostreams/filtering_streambuf.hpp>
00030 #include <boost/iostreams/filtering_stream.hpp>

00032 #include <boost/iostreams/filter/gzip.hpp>
00033 #include <boost/iostreams/filter/bzip2.hpp>
00034 
00035 using boost::iostreams::filtering_istream;
00036 using boost::iostreams::gzip_decompressor;
00037 using boost::iostreams::bzip2_decompressor;
00038 
00039 using boost::iostreams::error_counter;
00040 
00041 template<typename Reader, typename Stream>
00042     void ReadCSP(Reader& reader, ConcreteFileReader<Stream>* infile)
00043 {
00044     reader.read(infile) ;
00045     getTableOut().set(string("Filename"), infile->filename);  
00046 }
00047 
00048 template<typename InputReader>
00049 CSPInstance readInput(InputReader* infile, bool parser_verbose)
00050 {  
00051     string test_name = infile->get_string();
00052     if(test_name != "MINION")
00053       INPUT_ERROR("All Minion input files must begin 'MINION'");
00054   
00055     int inputFileVersionNumber = infile->read_num();
00056   
00057     if(inputFileVersionNumber > 3)
00058       INPUT_ERROR("This version of Minion only supports formats up to 3");
00059   
00060 
00061     // C++0x comment : Need MOVE (which is std::move) here to activate r-value references.
00062     // Normally we wouldn't, but here the compiler can't figure out it can "steal" instance.
00063     if(inputFileVersionNumber == 3)
00064     {
00065       MinionThreeInputReader<InputReader> reader(parser_verbose);
00066       ReadCSP(reader, infile);
00067       return MOVE(reader.instance);
00068     } 
00069     else
00070     {
00071       MinionInputReader<InputReader> reader(parser_verbose);
00072       ReadCSP(reader, infile);
00073       return MOVE(reader.instance);
00074     }  
00075 }
00076 
00077 
00078 CSPInstance readInputFromFile(string fname, bool parser_verbose)
00079 {
00080     const char* filename = fname.c_str();
00081     string extension;
00082     if(fname.find_last_of(".") < fname.size())
00083       extension = fname.substr(fname.find_last_of("."), fname.size());
00084   
00085     filtering_istream in;
00086     
00087     error_counter e_count;
00088     in.push(boost::ref(e_count));
00089     
00090     if(extension == ".gz" || extension == ".gzip" || extension == ".z" || extension == ".gzp" ||
00091         extension == ".bz2" || extension == ".bz" || extension == ".bzip2" || extension == ".bzip")
00092     {  
00093       if(extension == ".gz" || extension == ".gzip" || extension == ".z" || extension == ".gzp")
00094       {
00095         if(parser_verbose)
00096           cout << "# Using gzip uncompression" << endl;
00097         in.push(gzip_decompressor());
00098       }    
00099   
00100       if(extension == ".bz2" || extension == ".bz" || extension == ".bzip2" || extension == ".bzip")
00101       {
00102         if(parser_verbose)
00103           cout << "# Using bzip2 uncompression" << endl;
00104         in.push(bzip2_decompressor());
00105       }
00106       
00107     }
00108     
00109     // We need to use a pointer here, as we want to declare the object inside a for loop,
00110     // and we need it to live until after we've finished parsing.
00111     // We use an auto_ptr because it will auto-delete on exit.
00112     auto_ptr<ifstream> file;
00113     
00114     if(fname != "--")
00115     {
00116       file = auto_ptr<ifstream>(new ifstream(filename, ios_base::in | ios_base::binary));
00117       if (!(*file)) {
00118         INPUT_ERROR("Can't open given input file '" + fname + "'.");
00119       }
00120       in.push(*file);
00121     }
00122     else
00123       in.push(cin);
00124 
00125     ConcreteFileReader<filtering_istream> infile(in, filename);
00126 
00127     if (infile.failed_open() || infile.eof()) {
00128       INPUT_ERROR("Can't open given input file '" + fname + "'.");
00129     }   
00130     
00131     try
00132     {
00133       return readInput(&infile, parser_verbose);
00134       // delete file;
00135     }
00136     catch(parse_exception s)
00137     {
00138       cerr << "Error in input!" << endl;
00139       cerr << s.what() << endl;
00140       
00141         cerr << "Error occurred on line " << e_count.lines_prev << ", around character " << e_count.chars_prev << endl;
00142 #ifdef GET_STRING         
00143         cerr << "The parser gave up around: '" << e_count.current_line_prev << "'" << endl;
00144 #endif
00145         exit(1);
00146     }
00147 }
